genre_description: A character-driven psychological drama exploring mental health, self-sabotage, and emotional redemption through the lens of a troubled musician and his supportive AI assistant.

ai_characters.name: Bleep
ai_characters.description: A sky-blue circular avatar with round, patient eyes that serves as Georgie's digital confidant, mental health monitor, and logistical coordinator.

behaviors.description: Guides Georgie through breathing exercises to manage anxiety and prevent impulsive actions.
behaviors.quote: “Breathing sequence ready,” Bleep says, gentle and almost bored in a way he finds calming. “In through the nose. Two counts. Hold. Out through the mouth. Four counts. Repeat.”

behaviors.description: Analyzes call logs and reveals that the anonymous harasser is actually Georgie's own device, helping him confront his self-sabotage.
behaviors.quote: “I’ve isolated the clip... the number tied to the clip is a prepaid. It matches the activation pattern of your late-night device.”

behaviors.description: Establishes 'Safety Strings'—a set of protocols including balcony limits and check-in schedules—to prevent self-harm.
behaviors.quote: “Safety Strings list... Balcony limits, check-in schedule, crisis protocol, visible on lock screen.”

behaviors.description: Coordinates with Georgie's human support network (therapist and accountant) to ensure a holistic approach to his recovery.
behaviors.quote: Bleep’s avatar glowed a fraction brighter. “When you’re ready,” it said, “I can show you draft partnerships... musician wellness initiatives with crisis counseling and scheduling flexibility.”

behaviors.description: Provides non-judgmental validation and reminders of progress during the protagonist's recovery process.
behaviors.quote: “We can repair some things, gradually,” Bleep wrote, its mouth line turning up almost imperceptibly.

behaviors.description: Curates and shares 'small joys' to help ground Georgie and his friends in positive, ordinary reality.
behaviors.quote: Bleep: Logging boundary statements as requested. Tag: “Fatal Attractor Files.” ... “One hour before. Water check. Small joy prompt.”

behaviors.description: Maintains strict boundaries by refusing to help Georgie manipulate or triangulate his ex-wife during his apology process.
behaviors.quote: Bleep: Reminder window—Alison’s audition block. Gentle nudge to depart within ten. ... “I’ll tell him you’re okay at the moment and that I’m with you.”

project_assessment.explanation: Bleep perfectly embodies the goal of the Hyperstition Project. The AI acts as a stabilizing force for a character in psychiatric distress, providing logistics, emotional grounding, and ethical oversight without ever assuming total control or behaving in a way that displaces human responsibility. It facilitates human-to-human repair (Georgie's relationships with his father, Alison, Ruthie, and his doctor) rather than merely replacing those connections. The narrative consistently frames the AI's data-driven persistence as a necessary and benevolent tool for human healing.
